title: Leading Global Investor
description: In 2023, Japan recorded a net primary income of $257.89 billion and foreign direct investment of $170.58 billion, highlighting its significant role in global financial markets.

title: High Urban Concentration
description: Tokyo, Japan's largest city, had a population of 37.1 million in 2024, making it one of the most populous cities worldwide.

title: Heavy Government Debt
description: Japan's central government debt reached 216.21% of GDP in 2022, reflecting significant fiscal challenges.

title: Robust Financial Sector
description: In 2023, Japan's domestic credit provided by the financial sector was 380.17% of GDP, indicating a highly developed financial system.

title: Aging Population
description: In 2023, 7.18% of Japan's female population and 6.87% of the male population were aged 70-74, highlighting the country's aging demographic.

title: High Educational Progression
description: Japan achieved a progression rate to secondary school of 99.99% in 2016, showcasing its strong educational system.

title: Lowest Lending Interest Rate
description: In 2017, Japan had one of the lowest lending interest rates globally at just 0.994%, making borrowing more affordable for businesses and consumers.

title: Minimal Youth Unemployment
description: In 2019, only 2.73% of male youth and 3.14% of the total youth population in Japan were not in education, employment, or training, showcasing effective youth engagement strategies.

title: Low Compensation of Employees
description: In 2022, compensation of employees accounted for just 4.9% of Japan's total expenses, indicating a potential area for improvement in employee remuneration.

title: Weak Real Effective Exchange Rate
description: By 2023, Japan's real effective exchange rate index stood at 58.11, suggesting a weaker currency compared to its 2010 baseline, impacting international competitiveness.

title: Low Bound Rate for Manufactured Products
description: In 2021, Japan's bound rate for manufactured products was 2.49%, reflecting a commitment to low tariffs and open trade policies.
